question: God dammit Cathy I have no time for this crap! I'm supposed to be at the premiere of STAB 2 right Now, arm and arm with my girlfriend cause she's got a bit part in that over advertised piece of shit and I'm just going to humor her. You mena to tell me that in all your squandering the best you can do for me is A bit role in STAB 3 You want Respect, Cathy? Here's your respect. FUCK YOU! You're fired. Unfucking believable. Stab 3 What's up, B.D. with the B.D. Christine? Look, I'm stuck on the freeway. I think there was some big accident. It could be a little while so I don't want you to start freaking if I don't get there at exactly, Eight thirty. Oh I wouldn't miss it for the world. I bet you did such a great job. Heh heh I bet they are babe. I bet they are. Look, my battery's dying . . . Sure thing. Jesus. Hello?
answer: Hello.

question: Who is this?
answer: Who is this?

question: Well what number are you trying to reach?
answer: I don't know.

question: I think you got the wrong number, buddy.
answer: Do I?

question: Uh-huh. Look bro, my battery is running out. Really wish I could chat, but I can't so, later.
answer: Wait, wait. Don't hang up.

question: Asshole, Can't talk.
answer: But your voice sounds so familiar.

question: Does it now?
answer: You almost sound like that guy from THERE'S SOMETHING ABOUT CARRIE. Ben. Ben Damon.

question: Well ya got me. That's me. I'm Ben Damon.
answer: Really? You're such a talented actor.

question: Thanks.
answer: Now let's see you act your way out of this one.

question: What do you mean?
answer: I mean, I'm standing right outside the LADIES ROOM door at the PLAZA THEATER. Your girlfriend Christine is in there. She's all alone. Everyone's in the auditorium waiting for the film to start. I've got my knife.

question: Listen you sick fuck, is this your idea of a joke?
answer: More of a game really.

question: What kind of a game?
answer: You seem to be familiar with the STAB movies. Here's how we play. I ask you a question. You get it right, your girlfriend lives. You answer wrong, she dies.

question: I swear to God if you lay a finger on her I'll fucking kill you!
answer: Maybe so, but right now, we play the game. First question, Your girlfriend's counting on you, Name your girlfriend's character in STAB 2? Come on. Don't you know?

question: It's CICI! Cici's the name of the character she plays in the movie!
answer: Very good. Now we play ROUND 2.

question: What?! But I did everything you said to do!
answer: That's right. And you beat ROUND 1. Now we're taking the game to a whole new level. Meet me beneath the Hollywood sign in ten minutes. I'll have your girlfriend. We'll be waiting.

question: What?!
answer: Good bye Ben. You're not playing by the rules Ben. Don't you want her to live?

question: I swear to God if you lay one hand on her!
answer: No! You listen to me, if you're not where I want you in fifteen minutes I'll hollow her out. Do you understand?

question: Thank God I decided to do some community service. Yeah.
answer: Very good. You follow directions well. Now for the final part of the game. Put down the bat and approach the sign, slowly.

question: Where are you?
answer: Closer than you think.

question: Alright I'm here. What the fuck do you want from me?
answer: To see your reaction.

question: Good morning Hollywood. And today officially starts the Summer movie season. Opening the box office this week is Jeff Bridges and Tim Robins in Arlington Street, Eugene Levy and Jason Biggs in American Pastry, and Tori Spelling and David Schwimmer in STAB 2, based off my best selling book the WINDSOR MURDERS. Well I see a lot of the audience has dressed to the occasion. Today we have director of the upcoming STAB 3
answer: Good morning Gale. Pleasure to be here.

question: It's a pleasure to finally meet you, Roman.
answer: Well it's a honor to be here amongst so many fans of the genre. And I must say that any of you worried that Jerry Rapp, or Tori or David not returning to complete the STAB trilogy, have no fear, Roman is here. Aided with my excellent cast of newcomers I believe we're going to pull off one of the best Stabs yet.

question: Roman, from your enthusiasm it certainly seems that way. Honestly though, tell us, what's your favorite scary movie?
answer: Honestly, my life.

question: Your life?
answer: Well if you were in my shoes, dealing with those big Time Sunrise Studio producers like I do on a daily basis, you'd watch how quick your life goes from a Walt Disney picture to a Tobe Hooper flick.

question: Would you excuse me for a moment?
answer: Sure.

question: Jesus Christ you scared the shit out of me.
answer: I'm sorry Miss Weathers. Allow me to introduce myself, MARK KINCAID, L.A.P.D. Are you familiar with the actor Ben Damon, or the actress CHRISTINE PERKINS?

question: Well I interviewed Damon once for the show. He was a real obnoxious fuck. Any way, the second one, Christine Perkins, she had a part in Stab 2, didn't she? She was playing CICI.
answer: Both of them were found brutally murdered this morning under the Hollywood sign. Autopsy reports having come back to me yet but the bodies looked like something out one of the Stab films.

question: So is that why you're here? Is that why you're holding me from my show, to tell me about some brutal homicide I'm not even involved in?
answer: I wish that was all Miss Weathers, but there's more. The killer left a note.

question: A note? That's Sidney Prescott's mother.
answer: There's more. I've tried to get in touch with Sidney Prescott, but she's keeping herself very well hidden. You're my one and only hope in finding her. Her life may be in grave danger.

question: I'd love to help, really I wouldn't mind being sliced at again by a maniacal psychopath, but I honestly don't know where Sidney is. After Windsor she dropped off the face of the Earth. The only other person that might know is, , not going to talk.
answer: And who would that be?

question: And still the film is Number One at the box office this weekend. Beat out American Pasty and Arlington Street.
answer: I think Jeff Bridges is getting tired.

question: Nah I think it's doing so damn well because one of it's players got iced. I just hope none of us end up dead.
answer: Oh that's right. Those poor poor people. God Ben Damon was such a hottie.

question: Mr. Rielly, this was found alongside the bodies of Ben and his girlfriend.
answer: I promised Sid I'd keep her in seclusion. I promised her nobody would ever find her. If you don't mind Detective, I'd like to approach her with this on my own and see what she'd like to do about it.

question: That's fine Mr. Rielly, but if anyone else should die, I'm going to have to get a warrant.
answer: Understood. If you'll excuse me Detective. Gale.

question: They're the ones who approved it. Alright Kincaid, no where to?
answer: I go to the police station and do my job, and you go back to being Gale Weathers.

question: Oh. I thought you wanted me to stick around.
answer: Look, Miss Weathers, if there's a problem, give me a call. Here's my card. I'm always there.

question: Mom! This is Laura in Monterey reporting in for work. Thanks.
answer: Hello?

question: Yes, hi I'm Laura, I'm a trained counselor. How can I help you.
answer: Laura I think I just killed somebody.

question: Are you sure?
answer: Uh-huh I'm sure. I've killed someone! OH MY GOD I'VE ACTUALLY KILLED SOMEONE!

question: Well then the people you need to call are the police.
answer: No I need to call you. Just you.

question: I'm sorry, your voice.
answer: Don't you want to know how you can help, Sidney? Are you listening to me, huh?

question: Who the fuck is this?
answer: It's mother, Sidney, now be a good girl and turn on the news. DO IT!

question: Do you think it's over Sidney? Do you?
answer: W-what do you want?

question: I want to finish what I started. I want to finish the game.
answer: You sick fuck I'm tracing this call as we speak! The police are gonna nail your ass!

question: Let them try. You'll never find me. I've already gotten away with murder before. For instance, Maureen Prescott.
answer: No. You didn't kill my mother. Billy Loomis and Stu Macher did.

question: Heh. So you think Sidney. So you think. It's all been building up to this Sid. Every STAB. Every SCREAM. Every ounce of blood that's been spilled has all been leading up to this moment. WELCOME TOTHE FINAL ACT.
answer: The final act? Well let's play asshole!

question: No. We play in my court this time. Come to Hollywood. STAB 3's going to cutting corners cast-wise. And I've got my eyes set on a technical advisor named Dewey Rielly.
answer: If you lay a hand on him I'll fucking kill you!

question: STAB 3. Oh God I've gotta get myself a better agent. Anybody home? Doubt that. Anyone here?
answer: Stan! My man does great work.

question: Fuck you very much! Tyson go to hell! What the hell are you doing here? Where's Roman?
answer: Roman and everybody else went home for the night. I'm here for a make-up test.

question: Make-up. You need it. Hey, Roman isn't here?
answer: No.

question: Damn. He called my roommate and told her he had some important things he wanted to go over with me in his office tonight. For the honorary field of directing and cinematography in music videos. How to the point. Oh shit. Hello? Director's office.
answer: Sarah, it's Roman, I'm sorry I'm running late, I'm still on the 405, I'm about 10 minutes away.

question: Oh it's no problem, I'm just... looking at your music video awards.
answer: All right, since I got you on the phone, let's talk about your character.

question: What character? I'm Candy, the chick who gets killed second. I'm only in two scenes!
answer: You're not happy with your part.

question: I'm not happy that I'm 35 playing a 21 year old. I'm not happy that I have to die naked! And I'm not happy that my character is too stupid not to have a gun in the house after her boyfriend's been cut into McNuggets.
answer: Um hmm... umhmm great, so let's run the lines.

question: Huh, fine.
answer: Page 22, Candy's big moment.

question: Page 22.. Ring ring. Hello?
answer: Hello.

question: Who's this?
answer: Who's this?

question: This is Candy. Hang on, let me get some clothes. See! I don't' understand why I have to start the scene in the shower! The whole shower things been done, 'Vertigo' hello! And I mean, my boyfriend just died, why am I showering?
answer: Why don't we just read the scene? Candy, is that like candy cane or candy apple?

question: Whatever. Come on, who is this? I think you have the wrong number.
answer: But you know my favorite name?

question: I'm hanging up right now.
answer: It's Sarah.

question: Roman that's not the line.
answer: It is in my script.

question: Has there been another goddamn rewrite? How the fuck are we supposed to learn our lines when there's a new script every 15 minutes?
answer: It's not just a new script, it's a new movie.

question: What? What movie?
answer: My movie.

question: That's STAB 3, Miss Weathers. It looks like we're going to be getting a warrant to speak with Miss Prescott anyway.
answer: Shit. Sarah Darling. I interviewed her too. God, it's happening again isn't it Detective?

question: Yes well we have a suspect, so don't get that worried.
answer: Who?

question: I'm not at liberty to tell you that Miss Weathers. You're no longer working with the L.A.P.D. I don't even know why you're standing in here right now. By all means I should have you thrown out.
answer: But you won't. You're a good man detective. We think alike. I know you need my help. And I know you know I need your help.

question: In my fifteen years as a homicide detective I've never met a single soul as pushy and brazen as you are Miss Weathers.
answer: Please, call me Gale.

question: That's because I didn't.
answer: The guard said she was there for a meeting with you.

question: What meeting?
answer: We talked to her roommate, too. Says you called Sarah and told her to come down to the studio. Roommate answered the phone, says it was you.

question: Wait a minute! I never called her! I never told her to go anywhere!
answer: Roommate says she knows your voice, Mr. Bridger.

question: Well, she wasn't speaking with me! Look, I did not call Sarah Darling!
answer: Sarah Darling said you did.

question: They found another note?
answer: Uh-huh. Another News clipping. Another one about Sid's mom. Dewey, whether we like it or not it looks like we're going to have to go back into our past.

question: You mean OUR past as in Me and Sid. This has nothing to do with you Gale.
answer: This has everything to do with me Dewey. I was the one who brought the nation's attention to this shit anyway. I'll be damned if I'm gonna sit around and pass on the buck again.

question: Do you really mean it this time Gale?
answer: Yes. Look, let's get something straight Dewey, I got into this shit cause the police came looking for ME. Not cause I'm out to make the SUNRISE STUDIOS SLASHINGS.

question: Why would the police come to you?
answer: Again, I am the author of the definitive book on the Woodsboro murders.! What about you?

question: What about me?
answer: You said you'd never leave Woodsboro, 'The only place that's real!' But now you're here. Not with me. Dewey, I took care of you. I waited until you were well. I couldn't stay there, I mean, it's like dog years, one year in Woodsboro is like seven everywhere else.

question: So it's off to London for a week? New York for a month? L.A Forever?
answer: It was fucking '60 Minutes II'! I couldn't say no! I could've been the next Diane Sawyer!

question: What's wrong with just being Gale Weathers? I liked her!
answer: It didn't work Dewey. We tried, we're different.

question: You used to say that was our strength.
answer: Dewey, you're not just here because of that second rate K-Mart, straight-to-video version of me, are you?

question: Brace yourself, Gale, all of this is actually not About you.
answer: All of what Dewey? You do know something, don't you?

question: Off the record.
answer: Always.

question: Two months ago, the Woodsboro police got a call from a woman who said she was with 'Stab 3'. She wanted to see the file on Sid, for research.
answer: And?

question: The boys said no. She wouldn't give her name. A month later, the station gets broken into, the file room ransacked.
answer: Someone stole Sid's file?

question: I already removed it. I think someone on the film was trying to find Sid, and that's the only reason I came here. To make do a little private investigating of my own and make sure no one here was planning anything.
answer: I'm sorry, this is too good!

question: What part of 'Off the record' don't you understand?
answer: Right. Sorry. Do you think he did it?

question: I've got my suspicions but still, nothing you say can ever make me take my eyes off one person.
answer: And who is that?

question: Jennifer needs me.
answer: Jennifer?! Wait, where are you going off to?

question: I'm on duty. Stop following me.
answer: I happen to work for the police god dammit!

question: You're not a detective.
answer: Neither are you, Magnum P.I.

question: Gale, your engine's still running.
answer: Fuck!

question: Fuck!
answer: Gale Weathers. What a surprise.

question: Tom Prinze, tanked as usual. That's a shocker.
answer: Hey I really liked that piece you did on me last month. The one where you said my car accident was caused by me drinking and drugs, and how I faked the tire blow-out just so my insurance wouldn't sky rocket.

question: Heh, well, that's TV journalism for ya. Stage the news to boost ratings.
answer: Really, cause that stunt lost me the lead role in Roman Polanski's latest picture. Huh, what a coincide I was picked up by Roman Bridger. Well, not exactly the Roman I wanted. Get my point? STAB 3 is bullshit. Fuck, because of your big mouth I'm here, drinking piss water SCOTCH with Second rate fucking celebrities like Jennifer Jollie and yourself! Hey, I just got an idea. Maybe I should Have a look at your break line. That your car over there?

question: I think we should go inside. I have to have a talk with the cast. ALL OF YOU.
answer: You mean what's left of us. Yeah I'm running on empty anyways. Gotta refuel.

question: You! How can I ever get any fame playing you!
answer: Dewey, what the hell is she rambling about now? What's wrong Jen, see yourself on one of those USA NETWORK winners you did and realize how badly you suck at acting?

question: God damn you Gale Weathers! Don't you see? The killer is choosing his victims as they die in the script! Ben Damon's character was the first one to get offed. So was his girlfriend - but she wasn't cast yet so his real girlfriend was killed - then Sarah Darling's Candy, and now me!
answer: Wait a second, whoa! Calm down! Number one there were five different versions of the script given out. Ben Damon was given a fake script because he was only being offered the role. It only had fragments of real scenes from the actual script. And what, I die in STAB 3? AND I DIE NAKED?! UGH! This is complete bullshit. Who wrote this piece of crap?

question: I know right. It was kinda weak. That's cause Will Kennison only wrote a rough treatment of it. The script was written by some new guy. He wrote Arlington Street.
answer: Still that was a much better movie, I saw it at the premiere last week. God, what the hell am I getting sidetracked with this shit for?! We've gotta get down to business.

question: It's him! It's the killer!
answer: Listen you sick bastard, what the fuck do you want?

question: What's your favorite scary movie Gale?
answer: I dunno but I can tell you that your's will be the home video footage of me sticking my foot up your ass! Now come out and fight like a real man you pussy!

question: God damn it you two! Run! Hurry! He's dead!
answer: No! He's not dead! He's still breathing! Look!

question: Sid it's me, this is the sixth time I've called. Please pick up, I wanna make sure you're Okay. Sid!
answer: DEWEY!

question: What are you doing here? I told you to stay hidden! It's not safe for you up here.
answer: Well it's not safe for me up there either. The killer found me Dewey. He called me last night.

question: What?
answer: I figured I'd be safe If I was at least up here with the people I care about. Now where's this Kincaid guy the news is talking about? I found this place from a FOX 5 TV NEWS REPORT. Heh.

question: No.
answer: Do you have her number stored in your memory? Phone memory!

question: Oh. Yeah, I guess I do.
answer: Has anyone else every used your phone?

question: Geez.
answer: What the hell are you doing?

question: Being Gale Weathers. What the hell are you doing?
answer: I am Gale Weathers!

question: Here's how I see it. I've got no house, no movie, no gun, and I'm being stalked. Because someone wants to kill me? No, because someone wants to kill you. So now, starting now, I go where you go. That way, if someone wants to kill me, I'll be with you, and since they really want to kill you, they won't kill me, they'll kill you. Make sense?
answer: None.

question: You know in the movies, I play you as being much smarter.
answer: And as a sane person. For you that must be quite a stretch.

question: That's funny.
answer: Ha. Maybe I should join SNL.

question: Need to get in that building?
answer: No really?

question: There a story in that building?
answer: Possibly.

question: Gale Weathers would find a way. Basements creep me out.
answer: Really, you know you'd make a fascinating interview. Lifestyles of the Rich and Psychotic.

question: Look who's talking Moneybags. You got more homes than I do.
answer: Oh I wish I got that one on tape. It'd put a smile on my face everytime I'm down.

question: Can I help you?
answer: I'm Gale Weathers, author of the Woodsboro and Windsor College murders, and anchorwoman for TOTAL ENTERTAINMENT. Maybe you've heard of me?

question: I don't watch TV and I hate books. Whatta you need?
answer: Does the name Maureen Prescott sound familiar to you?

question: Nope.
answer: Well can you tell me if the woman in this picture looks familiar to you.

question: Listen, I'm busy. Nobody has access to those files except studio execs. Can you please go away now?
answer: Well if you won't work for me, will you work for the president?

question: When we did the first 'Stab" I realized I'd known Maureen Prescott before, I mean as Rina. I couldn't tell anyone. Can you imagine the press?
answer: And now? I mean, murders on your set and still you say nothing?

question: Get real, that would make me a suspect!
answer: Just because you knew her?

question: Yeah.
answer: I don't think so! Just what happened to Maureen when she was in Hollywood?

question: Now you listen to me, Lois Lane, let it go. It's dead and buried. Daddy took ol' Yeller out behind the barn and shot him in the head a long time ago.
answer: Well how would you like his rotten carcass dug up and drug all over National TV? Why don't you start talking.

question: It was in the 70's, everything was different. I was well known for my parties, Rina knew what they were. It was for girls like her to meet men, men who could get them parts, if they made the right impression. Nothing happened to her that she didn't invite, in one way or another, no matter what she said afterwards.
answer: Are you saying she was-

question: What do you know about trilogies?
answer: You mean like, movie trilogies?

question: You seem to like movies, Detective.
answer: Call me Mark, would you? Cause I'm gonna keep calling you Sidney.

question: I'll call you Mark when you catch the killer, Detective.
answer: All I know about movie trilogies is in the third one, all bets are off.

question: Did you request this case?
answer: No, they tend to put me on the ones that deal with the business. I grew up here, and I know my way around the studios.

question: Must be exciting, Beautiful place, beautiful people.
answer: To me Hollywood is about death.

question: Excuse me?
answer: I'm a homicide detective, remember? When you see what I see day in and day out, the violence that people do to each other, you get haunted. I think you know about that.

question: What do you mean?
answer: I know what it's like to see ghosts that don't Go away. To be watching a scary movie in your head, whether you want to or not, watching it alone.

question: Ghosts are tough, you can't shoot ghosts.
answer: Can't arrest ghosts. But the best way to stop being haunted is to be with people. You're here, you're not hiding, you've done the right thing, Miss Prescott.

question: Hmm.
answer: What did you know about your mother?

question: I used to think I had the perfect mom, perfect family. Till I found out I was wrong. She had a secret life, and I tried to understand that, and soon as I thought I had, more secrets. I don't' know who my mom was. Sometimes I feel like I'm just learning about my mother for the first time. You know, with TV and those movies and what not. God sometimes I feel like I'm just learning about myself for the first time. Like I'm watching my life instead of living in it.
answer: Here's the deal, I'm off to search the soundstage. That's good news.

question: How is that good news?
answer: Because, that means that we're dealing with an ordinary, flesh and blood killer. And I know how to handle guys like that.

question: Oh yeah, how?
answer: Catch him, or kill him.

question: Hey Detective? What's your favorite scary movie?
answer: My life.

question: John Milton.
answer: Wanna play a game?

question: Who is this?
answer: You tell me. You bankrolled three movies about me.

question: It's you. The saboteur whose been fucking up my movie! I swear to God if you don't stop I'll find you and have you killed! I shut down production on that piece of shit STAB 3! We had a no talent director and the lousiest Sidney Prescott on the planet but that was besides the point! You still killed MY movie! A John Milton film! And if you ever try and cross me again you'll be sorry. My next movie is gonna be a grandiose step up from this slasher shit! It's a film written and directed by John Sayles.
answer: Oh poor John. There's not gonna be another film. Well, at least not for you.

question: I need you as bait. For Sidney.
answer: Hello? Who is this? Um wh-who's calling? Gale, Dewey, whoever, um, call me back, I can only hear myself.

question: { a click } I only her you too, Sidney.
answer: Who is this?

question: Don't do it! If you do one thing to attract attention, one thing, I'll kill them both. Now, do you have somewhere we can be alone?
answer: Yes.

question: Go there. Always hard being friends with you, Sidney. When you're friends with Sidney, you die! Well these friends don't have to, Sidney. It's up to you.
answer: How do I know their voices are --

question: Don't you want to know Sidney? Don't you want to know who killed her? Don't you want to know who killed your mother?
answer: Where?

question: She'd have been so happy, Sidney, to know we'd be together.
answer: WHERE?

question: I'll call you, when you're on your way.
answer: Fuck! Yeah?

question: You follow directions good. Now let's wrap this production. Go to the Sunrise Studios backlot. I'll call you when you get there.
answer: Alright, I'm here. Now what?

question: You're doing real good. Can't you figure it out? I wanna finish this where it all began. Woodsboro.
answer: I thought you wanted me here? Alright I'm here, now show your face so we can finish this.

question: It's good to see you again Sidney. I was growing real impatient. Go ahead. Explore. I'll catch up with you later.
answer: Yeah?

question: Yeah?
answer: Help me Sid! The killer's got me!

question: Dewey?! OHMIGOD! Where are you?!
answer: Sid I can see you!

question: Where are you Dewey?
answer: I'm out back. Tied up. Hurry Sid! The killer's looking for you! Quick untie me! Good work Sid.

question: Who are you? GALE!
answer: Christ Sidney hurry up! That fucking lunatic is coming!

question: Gale he's got Dewey!
answer: I know! He killed Kincaid!

question: I know!
answer: Let's get out of here!

question: GALE WATCHOUT!
answer: Jesus Christ Sidney get out of here! He can't get us both! RUNNN!

question: Sidney?
answer: Dewey!

question: Where's Gale?
answer: They've got her!

question: Sid I want you to stay here! I'll be right back! I'm not gonna let them get Gale! Hold it right there you fucker! OH shit!
answer: Oh God.

question: Who the hell are you?
answer: Roman Bridger, director. And brother. She slammed the door in my face, Sid. Said I was Rina's child and Rina was dead. And it struck me, what a good idea! So I watched her, made a little home movie, a little family film. Seems Maureen, mom, really got around. I mean, Cotton Weary was one thing, everybody knew about that, but Billy's father, that was the key! Your boyfriend didn't like seeing his daddy in my movies. Didn't like it at all. And once I supplied the motive, all the kid needed was a few pointers. Have a partner to sell out in case you get caught, find someone to frame, it was like her was making a movie.

question: All the nightmares. All the hell I went through was because of you, you spineless bastard!
answer: I'm a director Sid, I direct. For example, Angelina over there, She's my partner. I can convince her to do anything. We've been dating since I met her in Woodsboro.

question: And I kinda keep her around cause it's a bit of a turn-on. You know, in the movies she's you Sid, so every time I jump her bones, I'm doing YOU, technically.
answer: Listen, I have no time for this. I've heard this shit before! So lets get on with it!

question: Wait a second Sid. Don't you go jumping the gun. You haven't seen the best part. With the aides of the computer revolution of y2kI've been able to steal your voice. Ain't it cool? Listen to what the police are gonna find next to your lifeless, mutilated body.
answer: I can't take it anymore. This Hollywood exploitation of the nightmare I lived has to be stopped. I did this to make you all repent for your sins, and now I'm pleased I've got my message across. Good-bye.

question: Awesome. What'd I tell ya? Heh. Did youknow that John Milton, was my daddy? Yep, he's the one who fucked mommy dearest in the long run. His parties, his flings, exploited the Hollywood nobody! That's whyI had to make him pay. Daddy dearest is dead. Mommy's dead. Looks like I'm an orphan all alone in this world. What a good reason to -- STAB MYSELF! See Sidney, as amateur as Billy and Stu were, they laid the groundwork for this! See Sidney, they also set the stage for you! Introducing to the world Sidney the victim! Sidney the survivor! Sidney the star! See Sid, now comes the part where we get away with it! The part where we win! Cause face it Sidney, in this world, the bad guys win!
answer: Roman knock it off! Do you people even know why you kill people? You kill people cause you choose to and not because of any other fucking reason!
